text: A bass is a type of male singing voice and possesses the lowest vocal range of all voice types. According to The New Grove Dictionary of Opera, a bass is typically classified as having a range extending from around the second E below middle C to the E above middle C (i.e., E2–E4).; The Oxford Dictionary of Music gives E2–e4/f4 Its tessitura, or comfortable range, is normally defined by the outermost lines of the bass clef. == References == Category:Vocal ranges Category:Opera terminology
title: Bass (vocal range)
